summary: multiple studies have suggested that adults with influenza who are underweight, overweight, or obese have increased risk of hospitalization compared with those of normal weight. we analyzed data from patients enrolled in the Sentinel Enhanced Dengue Surveillance System (SEDSS) from May 2012 to September 2018. underweight children were not at increased risk of hospitalization. obesity patients had longer mean length of stay once hospitalized. no reported disclosures.
